p: Inoculation with F. oxysporum and F. fujikuroi did not cause lesions on the leaves of I. cairica, whereas inoculation with C. gloeosporioides led to obvious infection symptom. The lesion area ratio caused by C. gloeosporioides was 2.11 ± 0.48% and significantly higher than that of inoculation with F. oxysporum ( n = 8, P = 0.000) and F. fujikuroi ( n = 8, P = 0.000) in addition to the negative control ( n = 8, P = 0.000). The results showed that F. oxysporum and F. fujikuroi were non-pathogens of I. cairica.
